description: In a cohort of 34 non-small cell lung cancer patients treated with pembrolizumab, an increased candidate neoantigen burden was associated with a higher chance of DCB and an improved PFS (median 14.5 vs. 3.5 months).
citation: Rizvi NA, Hellmann MD, Snyder A, et al. Cancer immunology. Mutational landscape determines sensitivity to PD-1 blockade in non-small cell lung cancer. Science. 2015;348(6230):124-8.
